images.copyright: Lantern Festival in Pingxi, Taiwan (© Jung-Pang Wu/Getty Images)
images.title: Flying high in Pingxi
images.caption: Lanterns alight in Pingxi
images.desc: The Lantern Festival marks the end of the Lunar New Year celebrations. The day of the festival is filled with food, dancing, firecrackers and children’s games while night brings a quieter, more thoughtful way to start the new year. After sunset, people gather to light and release paper lanterns into the dark sky. This multiple-exposure composite image shows the trail of 'sky lanterns' as they're ascending over Pingxi, a district in Taiwan. Many people think of the lantern as representing the ‘old you’. By letting it go, you release the past and can start the new year afresh.
